comment.name: Robert
comment.message: I have also setup a regular backup on my external hard drive, so far without any weird error hex codes. But I am also experimenting with Microsofts SkyDrive, which gives you 25 GB (!) of free storage. So far it worked really well. This way if my place burns down or I am travelling with my laptop I will still keep my important files :-)

comment.name: Robert
comment.message: Nice review! I really is a pretty decent phone. I am a bit shocked by a max of 2 days battery life, though. My HTC Magic can make 3 days if I don't use it much. Totally agree on the crappy music player that comes with it - I recently installed Mort Player (free), which seems to be a lot better.

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
About battery life: I learned it the hard way after the phone died on me - after just some 36 hours of usage. NES emulation seems to need a lot of juice. YMMV, as always.
I also use and can warmly recommend the Mort Player. Look at the picture of the phone in this review - the upper right shortcut actually points to Mort and not the default player (you can tell by the icon).

comment.name: PÃ¤r
comment.message: Emulation is a battery hog. Usually the emulator is written in a way that it doesn't sleep at all and is running the emulated CPU etc. all the time. I don't know what the official standby time is but the journalist tech geeks seems to charge their cellphones every evening. Only android 1.6... that ain't new... but it may be easier on the batteries with less features.

comment.name: Erik
comment.message: Yeah, 1.6 may not sound very exciting - it does work pretty well though so I can't really complain. But I am secretly looking forward to that rumored 2.x upgrade. Let's just wait and see.

comment.name: Erik
comment.message: Just to make things clear, an Android 2.1 update is available for this phone since several months back and it is working well. It does not slow down the phone (noticeably) and it fixes some problems - some web pages not working properly in the browser before now show up as expected, for example.

comment.name: Erik
comment.message: Sorry for taking so long time replying to this, but better late than never I guess. Fact is, the headset cannot be used when charging at all, it basically stays switched off while charging. The Creative headset does not suffer from this.

comment.name: Don McGuiney
comment.message: I really enjoyed your review. I have a problem. I bought the Plantronics unit but it won't play any sound. It installed very easyband shows in the control panel but I can't use them. Any suggestions? Thanks,

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
Hi Don,
there are a few things you can do to make sure things are set up properly. A common problem is that Windows is sending sound to the wrong device, since the OS can only direct sound output to one device at a time.
After connecting the USB dongle and having turned on the headset, right click the speaker icon next to the Windows clock and select "Playback devices". The headset should show up in the list. Now, select the headset and click the "Set Default" button (or select "Default communication device" if you only want to use it with Skype and the like). Click "Properties" and make sure the volume is not set to zero (under the "Levels" tab).
For mic setup, just select "Recording devices" instead of "Playback devices" and you will be able to figure out the rest.
The changes should take effect immediately, but in some cases you may have to restart the application playing sounds (Windows Media Player, Skype or whatever).
If this doesn't help, try using the headset with another PC.

comment.message:
Hia,
I have the same thing, i got it when i went to hong-kong, but i hate android 2.1
is there a way to root this thing?
Thnx!

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
Well, I'm not sure rooting it will really solve any of the inherent limitations of 2.1 - the lack of flash support is a major flaw, and I have yet to find a working solution.
But rooting is fun, so why not? I recommend you head over to the nice people at android tablets, they have a lot of good tips:
http://www.androidtablets.net/forum/
As for myself, I may do it sometime in the future. However, I'm not risking bricking this thing yet. ;)

comment.name: mark
comment.message: I purchased the ASK smart pad at HG as well. Have the keyboard as well. Can anyone tell me how to activate it?

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
To use the keyboard, you need to activate USB Host mode. Go to Settings, select "USB Mode Select" and tick "Host Mode". The keyboard (or other USB devices, like USB sticks) can now be connected.
After a reboot, the setting is reset and need to be reactivated. Apparently, it draws a lot of power so this should be a "good thing".

comment.name: julie clarke
comment.message: I have one, my husband just brought it back from Hong Kong. Its an ASK 741 SP if that helps. I cant wait to get playing on it but I cant get it to log in to our wifi at home. It finds it but then says its weak and drops off. I know our wifi is strong and so I dont know what to do to get on and start playing. Please please help

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
Hi Julie,
tough one. I had zero problems setting mine up. The router was set to use WPA2 with AES and a pre-shared key. My network showed up in the list (Wireless & network settings), I chose it, left security to auto, entered password and it just worked.
I would do the usual things; reboot the router, play around a bit with the security settings (on both ends), and, if nothing helps, try the tablet on a friend's network. Maybe the tablet just doesn't play nice with your router. Also, I have heard that there are compatibility issues between some 802.11n devices, 802.11b/g (slower/older router) should be fine though.
Hope this helps.

comment.name: Alexander
comment.message:
Erik, hi I've bought ASK 741SP (not 731SP) Device don't work, don't load OS - only start page Serviceman say that it's necessary to upgrade (firmware is damaged) , but manufacturer refused to upload firmware in order to I can solve my problem. Have U a firmware for 741SP, can U help me?
Thanks a lot!

comment.name: Erik
comment.message:
Hi Alexander,
I'm afraid I will have to disappoint you. I don't have the firmware for 741, neither do I know which one it uses or how to acquire it. If it's under warranty, just exchange for a new one.
If that is not an option, you can find a lot of information on how to install firmware/fixing bricked tablets here:
http://www.slatedroid.com
Please note that you always flash at your own risk.
Good luck!
